resources.string: Are you sure you want to delete the counter?
Detach the counter of the main counter to continue
You have already a counter with this name
You have already a project with this name
Do you want to save the changes?
The maximum must be 0 or more!
Do you want to add this rule in the project?
Do you want to modify this rule?
Are you sure you want to delete this rule?
Are you sure you want to delete this step?
Click on the image for more informations
If you want the counter to loop, you can set a maximum. After reaching this maximum, the counter will come back to 1. If you don\'t want any maximum, you have to write 0.
The number "round" is the number of time this counter has looped if you have set a maximum just above.
The position of the counter is used uniquely in the display of the project. 1 to be the first counter and x to be the xth counter.
If you mark the box, this counter will change with the counter of the project. Each time you increment/decrement this counter or the counter of the project, they both will change.
If you choose another counter here, the counter chosen will increment each time this counter loop and come back to 1.
If you mark the bax, the rule will start from the current state of the project, if you don\'t mark it, you have to enter a number just below to say when it has to start.
If you mark the box of the step, the step will be an incrementing one, orelse it will be a decrementing one.
The rule will be applied on the counter you indicate here. If you select "the project", the rule will follow the main counter.
The comment will be added to the text appearing in the reminder.
Are you sure you want to delete this comment?

This application was developed by
Luis Tascon Gutierrez
with the advice of
Alexandra Point
and the shop 'La roulotte aux pelotes'. 

This is an open source project, you can find it on Github at this address:
https://github.com/TGLuis/compteurDeLaRoulotte
 Feel free to give your opinion on the PlayStore or to collaborate on Github.

This application aim to simplify a knit project. You can create a project in the home screen. Once you are in a project, you can add counters, rules and comments that will help you manage your project.
Each counter has a name which is unique per project. It has a state, which represents the number of rows you have currently made with this counter.

For your project you can also have comments. These comments are described by a counter (or the project), a starting and an ending row, with a text. Once the counter indicated has as state a row which is in the interval described before, the text of the comment will appear in your project below your counter (or the project).

The rule is a manner to automatise some comments. In some project, you will have to do incrementation and decrementation. You can encode this to have a pop up every time a row is reached. For this, you will have to choose the counter on which you bind the rule. You choose the starting row, it can be the current row of the counter you chose. And you can optionally add a comment. Then you can add as many steps as you want. A step is in the format "X times each Y rows Z tiches" it means that it will warn you to increment (or decrement if you did not check the box) Z tiches each Y rows and all this X times. The steps have an order and follows one after another.
The state of the counter is not valid
Maximum of the counter is not valid
Position of the counter is not valid
Save the PDF in the project
There was a problem while trying to open the pdf
